intro: Centaurea fragilis var. subinermis, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, this perennial herb thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows, wastelands, and along roadsides.
